meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of a doctor
meanings.sent1: Her doctorial skills were evident in the precise way she diagnosed the illness.
meanings.sent2: The hospital staff admired his doctorial expertise in treating patients.
meanings.sent3: Despite his lack of medical training, his doctorial confidence was unmatched.
meanings.sent4: She approached the problem with a doctorial precision that impressed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The doctorial care she provided was gentle yet effective.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the degree or title of doctor
meanings.sent1: His doctorial thesis was well-received by the academic community.
meanings.sent2: Receiving a doctorial degree was a significant achievement for her.
meanings.sent3: He proudly displayed his doctorial diploma on the office wall.
meanings.sent4: The doctorial graduation ceremony was a momentous occasion for all.
meanings.sent5: Earning a doctorial title required years of hard work and dedication.

meanings.definition: possessing the qualities or skills of a doctor
meanings.sent1: The nurse's doctorial compassion towards patients was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent2: He demonstrated doctorial expertise in performing the surgery.
meanings.sent3: Even in stressful situations, her doctorial calmness never wavered.
meanings.sent4: His doctorial knowledge of medicine was unparalleled in the hospital.
meanings.sent5: The doctorial dedication of the medical team saved many lives.
